INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT


DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date]  INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 62-year-old male who presents with dyspnea with history of stent placement.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained. 

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (31645)

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624)

Endobronchial Biopsy(s) (31625)

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640)

Destruction of tumor/stenosis by method other than excision (APC) (31641)

Foreign body removal (31635)

Modifier 22: Substantially greater work than normal.
This patient required significant airway management and endobronchial thick inspissated mucus removal.
This resulted in >40% increased work due to increased intensity, technical difficulty of procedure, and physical/mental effort required.
ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope 

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality.
Initial Airway Inspection The airway was noted to be stable but with significant airway pressure.
A stent was noted to be migrated distally. 

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Proximal 1/3), Trachea (Middle 1/3), Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage BAL was performed in the Lateral Segment of RML (RB4) and Medial Segment of RML (RB5) with saline instilled and returned.
Instilled 20 cc of NS, suction returned with 10 cc of NS.
Samples were sent for Cell Count and Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).

Foreign Body Removal A foreign body (stent) was visualized in the distal trachea.
The Ultraflex Stent (14x40) was removed with forceps.

Excision of Lesion / Obstruction Endobronchial obstruction was noted and excised with mechanical debridement.
A significant amount of thick inspissated mucus was noted causing endobronchial obstruction at the level of the graft, leading to mucus trapping;
these were mechanically removed with forceps.

Endobronchial Tumor Destruction (APC) Endobronchial obstruction at the Distal Tracheal level was treated with APC.
Significant granulation tissue was noted and ablated to reduce obstruction using the following settings: 1.5mm probe, Pulse 30 effect 2, flow 0.5, for a duration of 2-3 seconds.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 70% patent. After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

Ultraflex Stent 14x40 

BAL RML 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

[REDACTED] is a 62-year-old male who presents for bronchoscopy for dyspnea with history of stent placement.
Critical airway watch for overnight. 

Consider CPAP overnight if patient goes into respiratory failure. 

Follow-up in AM with CXR.

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date]  INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 41-year-old female who presents with tracheal stenosis.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained. 

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration (31645)

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624)

Endobronchial Biopsy(s) (31625)

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640)

Destruction of tumor/stenosis by method other than excision (APC) (31641)

Foreign body removal (31635)

Modifier 22: Substantially greater work than normal.
This patient required significant airway management and endobronchial fibrinous debris removal.
This resulted in >40% increased work due to increased intensity, technical difficulty of procedure, and physical/mental effort required.
ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope 

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality.
Initial Airway Inspection The airway was noted to be stable but with significant airway pressure.
A stent was noted to be migrated distally. 

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Proximal 1/3), Trachea (Middle 1/3), Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage BAL was performed in the Lateral Segment of RML (RB4) and Medial Segment of RML (RB5) with saline instilled and returned.
Instilled 50 cc of NS, suction returned with 25 cc of NS.
Samples were sent for Cell Count and Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).

Foreign Body Removal A foreign body (stent) was visualized in the distal trachea.
The Dumon Stent (14x60) was removed with forceps.

Excision of Lesion / Obstruction Endobronchial obstruction was noted and excised with mechanical debridement.
A significant amount of fibrinous debris was noted causing endobronchial obstruction at the level of the graft, leading to mucus trapping;
these were mechanically removed with forceps.

Endobronchial Tumor Destruction (APC) Endobronchial obstruction at the Distal Tracheal level was treated with APC.
Significant granulation tissue was noted and ablated to reduce obstruction using the following settings: 1.5mm probe, Pulse 40 effect 3, flow 0.8, for a duration of 2-3 seconds.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 40% patent. After treatment, the airway was 85% patent.
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

Dumon Stent 14x60 

BAL RML 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

[REDACTED] is a 41-year-old female who presents for bronchoscopy for tracheal stenosis.
Critical airway watch for overnight. 

Consider CPAP overnight if patient goes into respiratory failure. 

Follow-up in AM with CXR.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality.
Initial Airway Inspection The airway was noted to be stable but with significant airway pressure.
A stent was noted to be migrated to the left mainstem bronchus. 

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Proximal 1/3), Trachea (Middle 1/3), Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage BAL was performed in the Superior Segment of LLL (LB6) with saline instilled and returned.
Instilled 20 cc of NS, suction returned with 10 cc of NS.
Samples were sent for Cell Count and Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).

Foreign Body Removal A foreign body (stent) was visualized in the left mainstem bronchus.
The Ultraflex Stent (14x60) was removed with forceps.

Excision of Lesion / Obstruction Endobronchial obstruction was noted and excised with mechanical debridement.
A significant amount of fibrinous debris was noted causing endobronchial obstruction at the level of the graft, leading to mucus trapping;
these were mechanically removed with forceps.

Endobronchial Tumor Destruction (APC) Endobronchial obstruction at the Distal Tracheal level was treated with APC.
Significant granulation tissue was noted and ablated to reduce obstruction using the following settings: 1.5mm probe, Pulse 20 effect 2, flow 0.3, for a duration of 2-3 seconds.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 70% patent. After treatment, the airway was 95% patent.
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

Therapeutic aspiration (31645)

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624)

Endobronchial Biopsy(s) (31625)

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640)

Destruction of tumor/stenosis by method other than excision (APC) (31641)

Foreign body removal (31635)

Modifier 22: Substantially greater work than normal.
This patient required significant airway management and endobronchial suture material removal.
This resulted in >40% increased work due to increased intensity, technical difficulty of procedure, and physical/mental effort required.
ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality.
Initial Airway Inspection The airway was noted to be stable but with significant airway pressure.
A stent was noted to be migrated proximally. 

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Proximal 1/3), Trachea (Middle 1/3), Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage BAL was performed in the Anterior Segment of RUL (RB3) with saline instilled and returned.
Instilled 50 cc of NS, suction returned with 25 cc of NS.
Samples were sent for Cell Count and Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).

Foreign Body Removal A foreign body (stent) was visualized in the proximal trachea.
The Dumon Stent (18x60) was removed with forceps.

Excision of Lesion / Obstruction Endobronchial obstruction was noted and excised with mechanical debridement.
A significant amount of suture material was noted causing endobronchial obstruction at the level of the graft, leading to mucus trapping;
these were mechanically removed with forceps.

Endobronchial Tumor Destruction (APC) Endobronchial obstruction at the Bronchial anastomosis was treated with APC.
Significant granulation tissue was noted and ablated to reduce obstruction using the following settings: 1.5mm probe, Forced Coag effect 2, flow 0.3, for a duration of 2-3 seconds.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 70% patent. After treatment, the airway was 85% patent.
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640)

Destruction of tumor/stenosis by method other than excision (APC) (31641)

Foreign body removal (31635)

Modifier 22: Substantially greater work than normal.
This patient required significant airway management and endobronchial suture material removal.
This resulted in >40% increased work due to increased intensity, technical difficulty of procedure, and physical/mental effort required.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality.
Initial Airway Inspection The airway was noted to be stable but with significant airway pressure.
A stent was noted to be migrated to the mid-trachea. 

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Proximal 1/3), Trachea (Middle 1/3), Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage BAL was performed in the Anterior Segment of RUL (RB3) with saline instilled and returned.
Instilled 30 cc of NS, suction returned with 15 cc of NS.
Samples were sent for Cell Count and Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).

Foreign Body Removal A foreign body (stent) was visualized in the mid-trachea.
The Aero Stent (12x40) was removed with forceps.

Excision of Lesion / Obstruction Endobronchial obstruction was noted and excised with mechanical debridement.
A significant amount of suture material was noted causing endobronchial obstruction at the level of the graft, leading to mucus trapping;
these were mechanically removed with forceps.

Endobronchial Tumor Destruction (APC) Endobronchial obstruction at the Distal Tracheal level was treated with APC.
Significant granulation tissue was noted and ablated to reduce obstruction using the following settings: 1.5mm probe, Pulse 40 effect 3, flow 0.8, for a duration of 2-3 seconds.
Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 50% patent. After treatment, the airway was 85% patent.
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

Aero Stent 12x40 

BAL RUL
